name: Camulos

attributes.attribute: name incorporated in the town of Camulodunum
identified Camulos with their war god Mars
father of the hero Fionn Mac Cumhaill

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Camulos, a British deity, has scarce artifacts to decipher the extent of his divinity, although his name was integrated into the essential township of Camulodunum, meaning “fort of Camulos,” currently referred to as Colchester. The Roman conquerors linked Camulos to their god of war, Mars. Researchers have proposed that he could coincide with the Irish patriarch Cumhall, who fathered the hero Fionn Mac Cumhaill.
